result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on January 12, 2023 at 10:00 am.

3:26 PM Defendant Andy J Gerow appeared by video Zoom.  Attorney Joseph M Norby appeared by video Zoom for Andy J Gerow.  Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews defendant's rights to be personally present, defendant would like to proceed by video Zoom, Court orally reviews Waiver of Right to Prelim, Atty Norby to file Waiver of Right to Prelim form electronically w/in 10 days, Court finds probable cause, binds defendant over for further proceedings, matter to be set for pretrial/Arraignment,
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Arraignment scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 10:00 am.
The Court granted Mr. Gerow's request to appear by Zoom.  Instructions to appear are attached.
Filed by Attorney Norby - address update for defendant and request to appear by phone
